addNotificationDelegate

public static void addNotificationDelegate(SwarmNotificationDelegate delegate)
Add a SwarmNotificationDelegate. The SwarmNotificationDelegate offers access to notifications before they get handled by Swarm.

Parameters:
delegate -

removeNotificationDelegate

public static void removeNotificationDelegate(SwarmNotificationDelegate delegate)
Remove a SwarmNotificationDelegate. The SwarmNotificationDelegate offers access to notifications before they get handled by Swarm.

Parameters:
delegate -

addLoginListener

public static void addLoginListener(SwarmLoginListener loginListener)
Deprecated. Please use SwarmUserManager.addLoginListener() Add a SwarmLoginListener. The SwarmLoginListener offers access to different stages of the user's login and logout process.

Parameters:
loginListener - The SwarmLoginListener to be added.

removeLoginListener

public static void removeLoginListener(SwarmLoginListener loginListener)
Deprecated. Please use SwarmUserManager.removeLoginListener() Remove a SwarmLoginListener.

Parameters:
loginListener - The SwarmLoginListener to be removed.

setActive

public static void setActive(Activity a)
Gives Swarm a handle to the specified (current) Activity. All of your Activities should extend SwarmActivity, but if they do not, then they need to call this method in onResume().

Parameters:
a - The Activity.

setInactive

public static void setInactive(Activity a)
Removes Swarm's handle to the specified (current) Activity. All of your Activities should extend SwarmActivity, but if they do not, then they need to call this method in onPause().

Parameters:
a - The Activity.

isOnline

public static boolean isOnline()
Checks if Swarm is running in online mode for this user.

Returns:
True if Swarm is running in online mode, False otherwise.

isLoggedIn

public static boolean isLoggedIn()
Checks if the user is logged in.

Returns:
True if the user is logged in, false otherwise.

isInitialized

public static boolean isInitialized()
Checks if Swarm is initialized. Swarm is initialized after a call to the method Swarm.init().

Returns:
True if Swarm is initialized, false otherwise.

isEnabled

public static boolean isEnabled()
Checks if Swarm is enabled. Swarm is enabled if a user has logged in at least one time before (has accepted terms and conditions).

Returns:
True if Swarm is enabled, false otherwise.

enableAlternativeMarketCompatability

public static void enableAlternativeMarketCompatability()
Disables Android Market links from within Swarm.

isSwarmEnabled

public static boolean isSwarmEnabled()
Deprecated. please use Swarm.isEnabled() Checks if Swarm is enabled. Swarm is enabled if a user has logged in at least one time before (has accepted terms and conditions).

Returns:
True if Swarm is enabled, false otherwise.

init

public static void init(Activity active,
                        int applicationId,
                        java.lang.String applicationAuth)
Initializes Swarm.

Parameters:
active - The context of the currently active Activity.
applicationId - The application ID for the application that is using Swarm.
applicationAuth - The application authorization key that corresponds to the application ID.

init

public static void init(Activity active,
                        int applicationId,
                        java.lang.String applicationAuth,
                        SwarmLoginListener loginListener)
Initializes Swarm.

Parameters:
active - The context of the currently active Activity.
applicationId - The application ID for the application that is using Swarm.
applicationAuth - The application authorization key that corresponds to the application ID.
loginListener - The loginListener to be set for the initialization.

Logs the user out of Swarm.

setAllowGuests

public static void setAllowGuests(boolean allow)
Configure whether or not Swarm will allow users to login with guest accounts. By default Swarm allows users to login with guest accounts.

Parameters:
allow - When true, Swarm will allow users to login with guest accounts. When false, Swarm will force users to login with a named account that has a username, password, and email address. If a user does not have a named account, then the user will be given the option to create a named account on login.

showGetCoins

Displays options to the user that allow the user to get more Swarm coins.
